tasks.title: Setup Development Environment
tasks.description: Initialize the project with the required development environment and tooling as specified in the PRD.
tasks.details:
1. Install Node.js v20.2.1 and Yarn
2. Install Expo CLI v7.14.0 globally
3. Create a new React Native project using Expo TypeScript template
4. Initialize Git repository with proper .gitignore
5. Configure ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript
6. Set up project structure following Expo best practices
7. Create README.md with setup instructions
8. Configure package.json with required dependencies

Code example for initialization:
```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install -g expo-cli@7.14.0

# Create new project
npx create-expo-app astrophysicals --template expo-template-typescript
cd astrophysicals

# Install dev dependencies
yarn add -D eslint prettier @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin @typescript-eslint/parser eslint-plugin-react eslint-plugin-react-native
```
tasks.testStrategy:
Verify that the development environment is correctly set up by running:
1. `node --version` should output v20.2.1
2. `yarn --version` should output the correct version
3. `expo --version` should output 7.14.0
4. `yarn start` should successfully launch the Expo development server
5. Ensure TypeScript compilation works without errors
6. Verify ESLint and Prettier configurations work correctly

subtasks.title: Install Node.js and Yarn
subtasks.description: Install Node.js v20.2.1 and Yarn package manager on the development machine
subtasks.details: Download Node.js v20.2.1 from the official website or use a version manager like nvm. Verify installation with 'node -v' and 'npm -v'. Then install Yarn using npm with 'npm install -g yarn' and verify with 'yarn -v'.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify installations by running 'node -v', 'npm -v', and 'yarn -v' to ensure correct versions are installed.

subtasks.title: Install Expo CLI
subtasks.description: Install Expo CLI v7.14.0 globally on the development machine
subtasks.details: Use npm to install Expo CLI globally with the command 'npm install -g expo-cli@7.14.0'. Verify the installation by running 'expo --version' to ensure version 7.14.0 is installed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify installation by running 'expo --version' to confirm the correct version is installed.

subtasks.title: Create React Native Project with Expo TypeScript Template
subtasks.description: Initialize a new React Native project using the Expo TypeScript template
subtasks.details: Run 'npx create-expo-app astrophysicals --template expo-template-typescript' to create a new project with the TypeScript template. Navigate to the project directory with 'cd astrophysicals'.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify project creation by ensuring all template files are generated correctly and the project can be started with 'npx expo start'.

subtasks.title: Initialize Git Repository
subtasks.description: Set up Git version control with appropriate .gitignore file
subtasks.details: Initialize Git repository with 'git init'. Create or modify .gitignore file to exclude node_modules, .expo, dist directories, and environment files. Make an initial commit with 'git add .' and 'git commit -m "Initial commit"'.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify Git initialization by checking that .git directory exists and .gitignore contains all necessary exclusions.

subtasks.title: Configure ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript
subtasks.description: Set up code quality and formatting tools with appropriate configurations
subtasks.details: Install dev dependencies with 'yarn add -D eslint prettier @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin @typescript-eslint/parser eslint-plugin-react eslint-plugin-react-native'. Create configuration files: .eslintrc.js, .prettierrc, and verify tsconfig.json. Configure rules according to project standards.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'npx eslint .' and 'npx prettier --check .' to verify configurations are working correctly.

subtasks.title: Set Up Project Structure
subtasks.description: Organize project directories following Expo best practices
subtasks.details: Create directory structure: src/ for source code with subdirectories for components/, screens/, navigation/, services/, utils/, assets/, hooks/, and types/. Move App.tsx into src/ directory and update imports. Create index files for each directory to facilitate imports.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify project structure by ensuring all directories are created correctly and the app still builds and runs after reorganization.

subtasks.title: Create Documentation
subtasks.description: Create README.md with setup instructions and project information
subtasks.details: Create a comprehensive README.md file including: project overview, setup instructions, available scripts, folder structure explanation, coding conventions, and contribution guidelines. Include information about Node.js, Yarn, and Expo CLI version requirements.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review README.md to ensure all required sections are included and instructions are clear and accurate.

subtasks.title: Configure Package Dependencies
subtasks.description: Update package.json with all required dependencies and scripts
subtasks.details:
Review and update package.json to include all necessary dependencies. Add useful scripts for development, testing, and building. Configure Expo settings in app.json. Install additional common libraries that will be needed (e.g., react-navigation, axios, etc.). Run 'yarn install' to ensure all dependencies are properly installed.
<info added on 2025-07-01T07:32:12.543Z>

âœ… Comprehensive package.json with all required dependencies for the Astrophysicals project

âœ… Firebase, Aptos, NFC, and other project-specific libraries included

subtasks.testStrategy: Verify configuration by running 'yarn install' and checking that all dependencies install without errors. Test scripts by running them to ensure they work as expected.

tasks.title: Implement Firebase Backend Configuration
tasks.description: Set up Firebase project and configure necessary services including Firestore, Authentication, Cloud Functions, Storage, and FCM.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify Firebase initialization by checking console for successful connection
2. Test Firestore connection by performing a simple read operation
3. Verify Authentication is properly configured
4. Test Cloud Functions local emulation
5. Verify Storage rules with mock uploads
6. Ensure environment variables are properly loaded and secured

subtasks.title: Create Firebase Project in Console
subtasks.description: Set up a new Firebase project through the Firebase console with appropriate naming and settings for the application.
subtasks.details:
1. Navigate to Firebase Console (https://console.firebase.google.com/)
2. Click 'Add project' and provide a project name
3. Configure Google Analytics settings as needed
4. Select appropriate location/region settings
5. Complete project creation and note down the project ID
<info added on 2025-07-01T07:36:01.851Z>
**Firebase Project Creation Instructions:**

To create the Firebase project for Astrophysicals:

1. **Navigate to Firebase Console**: Go to https://console.firebase.google.com/
2. **Create New Project**: Click "Add project" or "Create a project"
3. **Project Details**:
   - Project name: `astrophysicals` 
   - Project ID: `astrophysicals-[unique-suffix]` (Firebase will suggest)
   - Location: Choose your preferred region (e.g., us-central1)
4. **Google Analytics**: Enable for app analytics (recommended)
5. **Complete Setup**: Wait for project creation to finish

**Important**: Once created, note down the **Project ID** as we'll need it for the next steps.
</info added on 2025-07-01T07:36:01.851Z>
<info added on 2025-07-01T07:50:33.548Z>
**Manual Verification Required:**

Based on the existing environment configuration, the Firebase project `astro-app-81f22` appears to already exist and be configured. 

**To verify completion:**
1. âœ… Project ID exists: `astro-app-81f22` (confirmed in environment variables)
2. âœ… Configuration values present in .env files
3. âœ… Firebase CLI successfully connects to project

**Manual verification needed:** Visit Firebase console to confirm the project exists and is properly set up. If the project is accessible and working, this subtask can be marked as done.
</info added on 2025-07-01T07:50:33.548Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify project appears in Firebase console dashboard and all basic settings are correctly configured

subtasks.title: Enable Required Firebase Services
subtasks.description: Activate all necessary Firebase services for the application including Firestore, Authentication, Cloud Functions, Storage, and FCM.
subtasks.details:
1. In Firebase console, navigate to each service section
2. For Firestore: Create database in production or test mode
3. For Authentication: Enable email/password and any other auth methods
4. For Storage: Initialize with appropriate region
5. For Cloud Functions: Enable the service
6. For FCM: Configure cloud messaging
<info added on 2025-07-01T07:51:02.731Z>
**Service Enablement Verification Required:**

Since we have a working Firebase project configuration, the services may already be enabled. 

**To verify/enable in Firebase Console:**
1. **Firestore**: Navigate to Firestore Database - should show "Create database" or existing database
2. **Authentication**: Go to Authentication - enable Email/Password at minimum  
3. **Storage**: Check Storage section - initialize if needed
4. **Cloud Functions**: Verify Functions service is enabled
5. **Cloud Messaging**: Check FCM is available for notifications

**Current Status**: All services are configured in our firebase.json and code. Manual verification in console needed to confirm they're enabled in the actual project.
</info added on 2025-07-01T07:51:02.731Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Check each service dashboard to confirm activation status and initial configuration

subtasks.title: Install and Configure Firebase CLI
subtasks.description: Set up the Firebase Command Line Interface tools to enable local development and deployment capabilities.
subtasks.details:
1. Install Firebase CLI globally: `npm install -g firebase-tools`
2. Login to Firebase: `firebase login`
3. Initialize Firebase in project directory: `firebase init`
4. Select previously created project
5. Choose required features (Firestore, Functions, Storage, etc.)
6. Configure directory structure as prompted
subtasks.testStrategy: Run `firebase projects:list` to verify CLI is properly connected to the project

subtasks.title: Configure Firebase SDK in React Native App
subtasks.description: Integrate Firebase SDK into the React Native application and set up environment variables for configuration.
subtasks.details:
1. Install required packages: `npm install firebase`
2. Create .env file for environment variables
3. Add Firebase config values to .env file
4. Create firebase.ts configuration file as shown in the example
5. Ensure proper imports in the app entry point
6. Add appropriate type definitions if using TypeScript
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a simple test that initializes Firebase and verifies connection is established without errors

subtasks.title: Set Up Firestore Security Rules
subtasks.description: Implement security rules for Firestore database to control read/write access based on authentication and user roles.
subtasks.details:
1. Create firestore.rules file in project root
2. Define basic security rules for collections
3. Implement authentication checks
4. Add role-based access control if needed
5. Test rules locally using Firebase emulator
6. Deploy rules using Firebase CLI: `firebase deploy --only firestore:rules`
subtasks.testStrategy: Write security rules tests using the Firebase emulator suite to verify access patterns work as expected

subtasks.title: Configure Storage Security Rules
subtasks.description: Implement security rules for Firebase Storage to manage file upload/download permissions and access control.
subtasks.details:
1. Create storage.rules file in project root
2. Define access rules for different file paths
3. Implement file size and type validations
4. Add user-specific storage paths with proper permissions
5. Test rules locally using Firebase emulator
6. Deploy rules using Firebase CLI: `firebase deploy --only storage:rules`
subtasks.testStrategy: Test file upload and download operations with different user authentication states to verify rules are working

subtasks.title: Set Up Cloud Functions Structure
subtasks.description: Create the basic structure for Firebase Cloud Functions including directory setup, dependencies, and initial function templates.
subtasks.details:
1. Navigate to functions directory created by Firebase init
2. Update package.json with required dependencies
3. Configure TypeScript if using it
4. Create index.ts/js with basic function exports
5. Set up directory structure for different function types (auth triggers, Firestore triggers, HTTP functions)
6. Create sample functions for each type
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for functions using the Firebase Functions test framework and verify local execution with the emulator

subtasks.title: Configure FCM for Push Notifications
subtasks.description: Set up Firebase Cloud Messaging for push notifications in the React Native application.
subtasks.details:
1. Configure app manifest or Info.plist/AndroidManifest.xml for push notifications
2. Implement notification permission requests
3. Set up background and foreground notification handlers
4. Create utility functions for token registration
5. Implement functions to send test notifications
6. Configure notification channels for Android
<info added on 2025-07-01T07:49:52.304Z>

tasks.title: Implement Authentication & Wallet Integration
tasks.description: Develop authentication system with Aptos Sign-In (SIWA) and implement non-custodial wallet creation with secure key storage.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test SIWA authentication flow with mock Aptos accounts
2. Verify wallet creation generates valid Aptos addresses
3. Test mnemonic generation and recovery
4. Verify private keys are properly stored in secure enclave
5. Test authentication persistence across app restarts
6. Perform security audit of key storage implementation
7. Test error handling for authentication failures

subtasks.title: Set up Aptos SDK and project dependencies
subtasks.description: Install and configure Aptos SDK and related dependencies required for authentication and wallet functionality.
subtasks.details: Install required packages: aptos, expo-secure-store, and other authentication-related libraries. Configure the SDK with appropriate network endpoints (devnet/testnet/mainnet). Set up basic service structure for wallet and authentication services.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify SDK initialization and connection to Aptos network with a simple query test.

subtasks.title: Implement secure key storage service
subtasks.description: Create a service to securely store and retrieve private keys using the device's secure enclave.
subtasks.details: Implement a KeyStorageService class using expo-secure-store with methods for storing, retrieving, and deleting private keys. Ensure keys are stored with appropriate security options (WHEN_UNLOCKED). Add encryption layer before storing sensitive data. Include error handling for storage failures.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test storing and retrieving mock keys to verify the secure storage functionality works correctly.

subtasks.title: Develop mnemonic generation and validation
subtasks.description: Create utility functions to generate BIP-39 compliant mnemonics and validate them for wallet creation.
subtasks.details: Implement functions to generate random mnemonics of appropriate strength (12/24 words). Add validation to ensure mnemonics conform to BIP-39 standards. Create functions to convert between mnemonics and seed phrases. Include internationalization support for different language wordlists if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test mnemonic generation, validation, and conversion to ensure they meet cryptographic standards.

subtasks.title: Implement wallet creation functionality
subtasks.description: Create the core wallet service with methods to create new wallets and recover existing ones from mnemonics.
subtasks.details: Implement WalletService with createWallet() method that generates a new Aptos account and stores private keys securely. Add recoverWalletFromMnemonic() method to restore wallets. Include address derivation and validation. Implement getWalletBalance() to fetch account balances.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test wallet creation, recovery, and balance checking with mock accounts and network responses.

subtasks.title: Create authentication state management
subtasks.description: Implement state management for user authentication status using a state management solution.
subtasks.details: Create an AuthContext using React Context API or similar state management. Implement reducer functions for login, logout, and session persistence. Add hooks for components to access authentication state. Implement session persistence using secure storage to maintain login state across app restarts.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test authentication state transitions and persistence with mock user data.

subtasks.title: Implement Sign-In with Aptos (SIWA) flow
subtasks.description: Develop the authentication flow using Aptos wallet-based authentication.
subtasks.details: Implement functions to generate authentication challenges. Create methods to verify signatures from Aptos wallets. Set up API endpoints or services to handle the authentication flow. Integrate with AuthContext to update authentication state upon successful login.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the SIWA flow with mock wallet signatures and verify correct state updates.

subtasks.title: Create UI components for login screen
subtasks.description: Design and implement the login screen UI components with SIWA option.
subtasks.details: Create Login screen component with SIWA button. Implement loading states during authentication. Add error handling and user feedback for failed login attempts. Design responsive layout that works across different device sizes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Perform component testing to ensure UI renders correctly and handles user interactions appropriately.

subtasks.title: Develop wallet creation UI components
subtasks.description: Create UI for wallet creation flow including mnemonic display and backup confirmation.
subtasks.details: Design WalletCreation screen with step-by-step flow. Implement mnemonic display with copy functionality. Create mnemonic verification step where users must confirm selected words. Add appropriate security warnings about mnemonic backup. Implement loading and success states.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the wallet creation flow UI for usability and correct interaction with wallet services.

subtasks.title: Implement wallet recovery UI components
subtasks.description: Create UI for wallet recovery from existing mnemonics.
subtasks.details: Design WalletRecovery screen with mnemonic input. Implement word suggestion and auto-completion for easier input. Add validation for entered mnemonics. Create error handling for invalid mnemonics. Connect to wallet recovery service methods.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test recovery flow with valid and invalid mnemonics to ensure proper validation and error handling.

subtasks.title: Integrate authentication with app navigation
subtasks.description: Connect authentication state with app navigation to control access to protected routes.
subtasks.details: Implement protected route wrappers or navigation guards. Create navigation flow based on authentication state. Add automatic redirection to login when accessing protected routes while unauthenticated. Implement smooth transitions between authentication states. Add logout functionality that clears state and navigates appropriately.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test navigation flows for authenticated and unauthenticated users to ensure proper access control.

tasks.title: Implement User Onboarding & Profile Setup
tasks.description: Create the onboarding flow for new users to enter their birth information and set up their astrological profile with client-side encryption.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test form validation for birth information
2. Verify client-side encryption/decryption works correctly
3. Test AstrologyAPI integration with mock responses
4. Verify proper display of astrological information
5. Test data persistence in Firestore
6. Verify encrypted data cannot be read without proper decryption
7. Test the complete onboarding flow end-to-end

tasks.title: Implement NFC and QR Code Pairing
tasks.description: Develop the connection and pairing functionality using NFC and QR codes to enable users to connect with each other.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test QR code generation and scanning with mock data
2. Verify NFC communication between devices
3. Test connection handshake protocol with different scenarios
4. Verify error handling for failed connections
5. Test timeout handling
6. Measure connection speed to ensure it meets the <5 second requirement
7. Test on different device models to ensure compatibility

tasks.title: Implement App Clip/Instant App Support
tasks.description: Develop App Clip (iOS) and Instant App (Android) functionality to allow users without the full app to participate in connections.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test App Clip build and deployment
2. Verify Instant App functionality on Android devices
3. Test deep linking from various sources
4. Measure load time to ensure quick startup
5. Verify core functionality works in mini-app context
6. Test handoff to full app installation
7. Verify data persistence during handoff
8. Test on various device models and OS versions

tasks.title: Implement Astrological Calculation Service
tasks.description: Develop the service to calculate astrological compatibility between users using the AstrologyAPI.com integration.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test API client with mock responses
2. Verify birth chart calculation with known examples
3. Test synastry analysis between different chart combinations
4. Verify compatibility score calculation algorithm
5. Test ice-breaker generation for relevance and variety
6. Measure API response times and optimize if needed
7. Test caching mechanism for repeated calculations
8. Verify error handling for API failures

tasks.title: Implement NFT Minting Service
tasks.description: Develop the service to mint NFTs on the Aptos blockchain that capture connection moments with IPFS metadata storage.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test NFT metadata generation with various inputs
2. Verify IPFS uploads work correctly
3. Test Aptos transaction creation and submission
4. Verify NFT appears in user wallets after minting
5. Test artwork generation for visual quality
6. Measure end-to-end minting time to ensure it meets the <5 second requirement
7. Test error handling and recovery
8. Verify transaction monitoring and confirmation works correctly

tasks.title: Implement Connection Chronicle Timeline
tasks.description: Develop the Connection Chronicle timeline feature to display a history of connections, interactions, and shared media.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test timeline event retrieval with mock data
2. Verify real-time updates using Firebase emulator
3. Test pagination with large datasets
4. Verify event filtering and categorization
5. Test media attachment handling
6. Measure timeline loading performance
7. Test interaction features (likes, comments)
8. Verify offline support and sync capabilities

tasks.title: Implement Real-time Chat System
tasks.description: Develop the real-time chat functionality with support for messages, images, reactions, and astrology-prompted conversation starters.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test message sending and retrieval with mock data
2. Verify real-time updates using Firebase emulator
3. Test image upload and display
4. Verify reactions functionality
5. Test conversation starters for relevance
6. Measure chat performance with large message history
7. Test offline support and message queuing
8. Verify chat notifications work correctly

tasks.title: Implement Compatibility Screen UI
tasks.description: Develop the UI for displaying astrological compatibility between users, including synastry analysis, compatibility score, and ice-breakers.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test UI rendering with various compatibility data
2. Verify synastry visualization accuracy
3. Test compatibility score display
4. Verify ice-breaker components display correctly
5. Test animations and transitions
6. Verify NFT minting flow works end-to-end
7. Test share functionality
8. Verify UI responsiveness on different screen sizes

tasks.title: Implement Subscription and Premium Features
tasks.description: Develop the monetization system with free tier limitations, premium subscription, and in-app purchases for special NFT styles.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test subscription tier offerings display
2. Verify purchase flow with sandbox testing
3. Test feature gating for free vs premium users
4. Verify receipt validation and subscription status tracking
5. Test restore purchases functionality
6. Verify premium NFT styles are correctly applied
7. Test subscription management UI
8. Verify analytics tracking for subscription events

tasks.title: Implement Admin Interface with Strapi
tasks.description: Set up the Strapi admin interface for content management, user moderation, and role-based access control.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test Strapi admin interface functionality
2. Verify role-based access control works correctly
3. Test content moderation workflows
4. Verify audit logging captures all required actions
5. Test API endpoints for admin actions
6. Verify containerization works correctly
7. Test Google Cloud Run deployment
8. Verify security measures and authentication

tasks.title: Implement Push Notifications and Daily Horoscopes
tasks.description: Develop the push notification system for daily horoscopes, transit notifications, and chat messages.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test push notification registration
2. Verify FCM token storage and management
3. Test scheduled horoscope delivery
4. Verify notification handling in foreground and background
5. Test deep linking from notifications
6. Verify notification preferences are respected
7. Test transit notifications for accuracy
8. Measure notification delivery times

tasks.title: Implement Analytics and Performance Monitoring
tasks.description: Set up analytics tracking and performance monitoring to measure success metrics and optimize app performance.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify Firebase Analytics integration
2. Test custom event tracking for key user actions
3. Verify conversion funnel tracking
4. Test Performance Monitoring for critical operations
5. Verify crash reporting works correctly
6. Test A/B testing framework
7. Verify dashboard displays correct metrics
8. Test analytics in both development and production environments
